III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member smuggled marijuana candy into the facility and
provided it to youths. The staff was seen talking to one of the boys
and then dropped the candy into the garbage can and the boys
picked it up. The boys were acting a little strange and their eyes
were red. The boys tested positive for marijuana.
Investigation Interviews
Director was interviewed on 07/10/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention Facility (WCJDF). Director stated Volunteer is
no longer allowed onsite and the allegation of this investigation
was forwarded to local law enforcement.
Youth A was interviewed on 07/10/2025 at WCJDF. Youth A
stated Youth C gave him two round, orange, hard pieces of candy
and some chips after asking if he was hungry. Youth A stated he
did not believe Youth C when Youth C told him that he gave him
an edible. Youth A stated he did not feel under the influence when
staff and supervisors (does not recall who) checked on him but
began to feel the effects of the edible when he was at the hospital
for a drug test. Youth A stated he tested positive for cannabis.
Youth A stated he has no idea how Youth C obtained the edible.
Youth A stated Volunteer was on the unit on 07/02/2025. Youth A
stated Volunteer talks with the youths about their re-entry plans
from WCJDF to the community.
Youth B was interviewed on 07/10/2025 at WCJDF. Youth B
stated Youth C asked if he was hungry and then gave him a piece
of a brownie and one round, green, chewy candy. Youth B stated
he got a headache after eating the brownie and candy and laid
down in his room during shower time. Youth B stated Youth C
kept coming to his room and asking how he felt. Youth B stated
Youth C told him that he ate an edible. Youth B stated staff
checked on him and he was taken to the hospital for an
evaluation. Youth B stated he tested positive for cannabis. Youth
2

B stated he later learned from staff (does not recall who) that
Youth C obtained the edible from Volunteer. Youth B stated he
would not have ingested the edible and jeopardized his soon
expected release from WCJDF.
Youth C was interviewed on 07/10/2025 at WCJDF. Youth C
stated he tested positive for cannabis after eating a chewy, blue,
square piece of candy. Youth C stated he was “so high” that he
cannot recall how he obtained this piece of candy or how Youth A,
Youth B, Youth D also tested positive for cannabis.
Youth D was interviewed on 07/10/2025 at WCJDF. Youth D
stated Youth C gave him, Youth A, and Youth B candy that was
colorful (does not recall the colors), oval shaped, and chewy from
a clear bag. Youth D stated Youth C also ate a piece of candy
from the bag. Youth D stated he and Youth A, Youth B, and Youth
C went to the hospital and tested positive for cannabis. Youth D
stated he did not have any side effect from eating the candy and
does not know how he tested positive for cannabis. Youth D
stated he does not know where Youth C got the candy.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 07/21/2025 by phone. Staff 1 stated
she had limited contact with Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and
Youth D on 07/02/2025 because she was monitoring the youths
on the other side of Unit 3C. Staff 1 stated Staff 3 provided
staffing coverage when she went on break and when she returned
Staff 3 told her that Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D
appeared “sluggish” and not themselves. Staff 1 stated she
checked on them and noticed their bloodshot eyes and lethargic
behavior. Staff 1 stated Supervisor 1 and another supervisor
(does not recall who) came to the unit and checked each youth.
Staff 1 stated a nurse was on the unit preparing for bedtime
medication dispensing and assisted in checking on each youth.
Staff 1 stated Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were taken
off the unit for further evaluation. Staff 1 stated youth bedrooms
and the unit were searched, and contraband was not found. Staff
1 stated a volunteer was on Unit 3C on 07/02/2025 and had
contact with Youth A, Youth B, Youth C and Youth D but she did
not witness anything unusual.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 07/23/2025 by phone. Staff 2 stated
Volunteer was on the unit playing cards and talking with Youth A,
Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D before she left on break. Staff 2
stated when she returned from break Staff 1 told her that Youth A,
Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were in their rooms and not their
usual selves. Staff 2 stated she went to Youth A’s room and found
3

him reading a book held upside down. Staff 2 stated she found
Youth B and Youth C in their rooms (with their doors open) with
bloodshot eyes and not making direct eye contact. Staff 2 stated
she found Youth D asleep on top of his mattress that he placed on
the ground in his room. Staff 2 stated nothing was unusual with
the other youths on the unit. Staff 2 stated Supervisor 1 and a
nurse came on the unit and assisted in checking on the youths.
Staff 2 stated Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were sent
to the hospital for an evaluation. Staff 2 stated she later learned
that the youths tested positive for cannabis but she does not know
how they obtained it.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 08/01/2025 by phone. Staff 3 stated
she worked Unit 3C on 07/02/2025 when she relieved a staff
(does not recall who) for break. Staff 3 stated she did not get a
response when she asked Youth B why his eyes were red. Staff 3
stated Youth B stood without moving and needed additional
prompts to get ready for showers. Staff 3 stated the other staff
(does not recall who) on the unit also noticed several youths with
bloodshot eyes and not acting like their typical playful selves. Staff
3 identified Youth A as one of these youths. Staff 3 stated she left
the unit when staff returned from break and reported her youth
observations to Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2. Staff 3 stated she
recalled thinking it was odd that Volunteer entered and exited the
unit multiple times and talked with youths briefly in a ‘huddle” but
did not suspect anything.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 07/17/2025 at WCJDF.
Supervisor 1 stated Staff 3 approached her and asked her to go to
Unit 3C to check on the youths with bloodshot eyes and staying in
their rooms instead of the common area during shower time
because these were usually active youths. Supervisor 1 stated
Supervisor 2 joined her on Unit 3C and they checked on each
youth. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth
D had bloodshot eyes. Supervisor 1 stated she asked Youth A if
he took anything and he replied that he was tired. Supervisor 1
stated she spoke with Staff 2 and Staff 2 suspected Volunteer
may have given Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D
something because he was around them. Supervisor 1 stated
Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were sent off grounds for
a medical evaluation. Supervisor 1 stated she reviewed the video
footage and saw Volunteer speak with Youth C, walk to the
garbage can, pull something form his pocket, and drop it into the
garbage can. Supervisor 1 stated a few seconds later Youth C
walked to the garbage can, took something out of the garbage
can, and placed it inside the front of his pants.
4

Supervisor 2 was interviewed on 07/31/2025 at WCJDF.
Supervisor 2 stated Staff 3 approached her in the hallway and told
her that four Unit 3C youths were acting strangely with bloodshot
eyes. Supervisor 2 stated she and Supervisor 1 went to Unit 3C to
check on the youths. Supervisor 2 stated all the youths appeared
as usual except for Youth A, who was in his room with bloodshot
eyes, Youth B and Youth D, who were asleep in their rooms, and
Youth C, who was in the common area with bloodshot eyes.
Supervisor 2 stated it was unusual for Youth A, Youth B, Youth C,
and Youth D to not be talking and moving about the unit.
Supervisor 2 stated Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were
sent to the hospital for further evaluation. Supervisor 2 stated she
did not recall anything unusual with the volunteer activities on
07/02/2025.
Attempt to interview Volunteer by phone was made on
08/01/2025 and 08/06/2025. Volunteer’s last known telephone
number is not in service.
Video
Unit 3C video footage on 07/02/2025 was reviewed. Volunteer
pulls something from his pocket and drops it into a garbage can.
Youth C walks to the garbage can, takes something out, and
places it inside the front of his pants. It cannot be determined from
the video footage what was dropped into and taken out of the
garbage can. The item appears small and fits inside a fist.
Volunteer walks around the unit among staff and youths. Youth C
has two quick, separate hand-to-hand contacts with youths at one
end of the gymnasium by the staff desk. One of the youths places
something in his mouth after his hand-to-hand contact with Youth
C.
Documentation Reviewed
Staff 2 and Supervisor 1 documented this incident on an incident
report on 07/03/2025 at 12:39 AM and 2:21 AM that coincides with
their interview.
Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were evaluated at a
hospital on 07/02/2025 around 11:30 PM. Each youth denied drug
use but their urine drug test came back positive for cannabis.
Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were discharged back to
WCJDF on 07/03/2025.
5

Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance in providing for the needs,
protection, and supervision of Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and
Youth D when they were able to obtain and ingest cannabis on
07/02/2025.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
